title: The Sontaran Experiment
dialogue_triumphs: Vural: 'Clock expert?' Doctor: 'Horologist, actually, and chronometrist. I just love clocks: atomic clocks, quartz clocks, grandfather clocks… Cuckoo clocks…'
dialogue_disasters: Harry: 'I feel a bit like a Morse message: slightly scrambled.'
goofs: Obvious use is made of stand-ins during the fight with Styre.
During the fight the Sontaran's head is knocked sideways.
Why only send one Sontaran? (Numbers are surely not at a premium in a cloned race?)
Why is Styre experimenting on humans prior to an invasion of Earth when the planet is depopulated anyway?

continuity_notes.name: Field Major Styre
continuity_notes.description: A Sontaran from the G3 Military Assessment Survey, conducting experiments on humans.
continuity_notes.current_status: Conducting experiments on Earth prior to a planned invasion.

continuity_notes.name: Sontarans
continuity_notes.description: A cloned warrior race with some morphological diversity.

continuity_notes.name: Grand Strategic Council
continuity_notes.description: The main Sontaran military leadership group.

continuity_notes.name: Terrulian diode bypass transformer
continuity_notes.description: A vital part of Sontaran recharging equipment, allowing them to feed on pure energy.
continuity_notes.current_status: Used in Styre's equipment, vulnerable to sabotage.

continuity_notes.name: 500 Year Diary
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's diary containing notes on various species and events.
continuity_notes.current_status: In the Doctor's possession, containing notes on Sontarans.

continuity_notes.name: Sonic Screwdriver
continuity_notes.current_status: Used to repair transmat spheres and disable robots.

locations.name: Earth
locations.description: The planet where the story takes place, possibly in London.
locations.current_status: Depopulated but habitable for several thousand years.

locations.name: Nerva
locations.description: A space station in Earth orbit, also known as 'the lost colony'.
locations.current_status: Undiscovered, believed to be a legend.

future_history: By the time of 'The Ark in Space', Earth has been without any form of animal life for around 10,000 years. However, Earth has been habitable for several thousand years. Other Earth colonies, such as Galsec, have established large empires. With humans in control of around half of the galaxy, many of the empires have no time for 'Mother Earth' philosophies. It is commonly believed that Earth is still uninhabitable.
additional_notes: The episode exposes the padding in many Doctor Who stories by completing its narrative with great economy.
bottom_line: 'The Sontaran Experiment' succeeds despite its obvious limitations. It has a virtual film look, although neither the robot nor the deflection of the Marshal's invasion plans are wholly convincing.
